programme.title: Īpašo uzdevumu vienība Hawaii 5-0 10
programme.desc: Par „Hawaii 5-0” vienības veiklību vairs neviens nav jāpārliecina – no šīs komandas prasmīgā tvēriena nav izmucis gandrīz neviens noziedznieks – slepkavas, kontrabandisti, narkotiku tirgoņi, zagļi un artefaktu mednieki ar netīru sirdsapziņu. Seriāla desmitajā un noslēdzošajā sezonā Stīvs Makgarets kopā ar komandu turpinās izmeklēt dažādus noziegumus, kas pastrādāti kādā no Havaju salām, un galu galā uzveiks pretinieku, kurš visus savedis kopā.

programme.title: Austrālijas zelta meklētāji 2
programme.desc: Austrālijas tuksnešainais smiltājs slēpj kādu retu dārgumu – zeltu. Trīs zelta drudža pārņemtas komandas dodas šī dārgmetāla medībās, neļaujot tveicīgajam karstumam, čūskām vai krūmu ugunsgrēkiem tās apturēt. Lai sasniegtu sapni par bagātību, laimes meklētāji pat gatavi riskēt ar saviem ietaupījumiem. Šajā sezonā "Smilšu suņu" mērķis ir iespaidīgs – 11 kilogramu zelta. Kristīnei un Gregam vajag vismaz 1,2 kilogramus tīrradņu, lai paglābtos no izputēšanas. Ambiciozais pāris Lekija un Teds sapņo par 2 kilogramiem. Jaunpienācējs Riks cer kļūt par 567 gramiem zelta bagātāks. Bet Kellija un Harijs liks lietā visparastākos metāla detektorus, lai šosezon sasniegtu 1,7 kilogramu mērķi.

programme.title: Noliktavu kari 11
programme.desc: Ja Kalifornijas štatā, ASV, par mantu glabātuvi netiek maksāts trīs mēnešus, noliktavas īpašnieks tā saturu drīkst izpārdot izsolē. Šovs seko vairākiem šādu izsoļu dalībniekiem, kur ar to nodarbojas profesionāli. Pirms katras izsoles tiek atvērta mantu glabātuve, un potenciālie pircēji piecas minūtes var aplūkot to saturu, taču viņi nedrīkst iet iekšā, lai apskatītos tuvāk, vai glabātuvē esošajās mantās ir kas vērtīgs. Kad izsole ir galā, uzvarētājs izpēta, ko tieši ir iegādājies un ar ekspertu palīdzību nosaka katras lietas vērtību, lai saprastu – šis pirkums ir nesis peļņu vai zaudējumus un cik lielus.

programme.title: Virsotne. Jaunzēlande 2
programme.desc: Aizraujošas izturības sacīkstes, kur fiziskās un emocionālās robežas tiek pārbaudītas līdz lūzuma punktam. 15 svešinieki, tostarp vairākas Austrālijas slavenības, dodas piedzīvojumā – sasniegt kalna virsotni. Starp dalībniekiem vienādās daļās ir sadalīti 750 tūkstoši dolāru, ko katrs šai pārgājienā nes sev līdzi mugursomā. Vēl 250 tūkstoši gaida kalnā, bet vai viņi pagūs laikā, lai šo summu iegūtu? Pārgājiena laikā dalībniekiem būs jāstrādā kā komandai, pārvarot bīstamu reljefu, skarbus laikapstākļus un adrenalīna pilnus izaicinājumus. Ja pārgājiena dalībnieks izstājas, jāatvadās arī no viņa mugursomā esošās naudas. Dalībniekiem virsotne jāsasniedz 15 dienās, citādi naudas balva tiks zaudēta. Ceļā viņus gaida nežēlīgi pavērsieni – arī iespēja nozagt cita dalībnieka naudu. Vai viņi sasniegs virsotni laikā un kurš dosies prom ar naudu?

programme.title: Terminators 2: Sprieduma diena
programme.desc: Ir radīts jauns kiborgs – slepkava, identisks tam, kurš reiz mēģināja nogalināt Sāru Konoru, bet viņam tas neizdevās. Šoreiz terminatora jaunāka versija no nākotnes atsūtīta nogalināt Sāras desmit gadus veco dēlu Džonu, lai viņš nekļūtu par cilvēces pretošanās vadītāju. Tomēr Sāra nebūs vienīgā, kas sargās dēlu – viņai palīgā atsūtīts vēl viens terminators ar misiju – aizsargāt Sāru un Džonu par jebkādu cenu. Un cīņa par nākotni var sākties.

programme.title: Rokijs 4
programme.desc: Boksa čempions Rokijs ir kļuvis par sava drauga Apollo treneri. Kad Apollo boksa ringā nogalina krievu bokseris Ivans Drago, Rokijs notikušajā vaino sevi un izaicina Ivanu uz boksa maču. Neklausoties sievas Edrianas iebildumos, Rokijs pošas ceļā uz Krieviju, cerot atriebt drauga nāvi.

programme.title: Patagonija. Dzīve pasaules malā
programme.desc: Patagonija – viena no unikālākajām vietām uz Zemes, kur augsne ir neauglīga, bet jūra ir dzīvības bagāta. Izmantojot zemūdens kameras, helikopterus, dronus un GoPro kameras, vesela gada garumā filmēšanas komanda iemūžinājusi unikālus kadrus ar retiem dzīvniekiem, kādus nereti nav iespējams sastapt nekur citur. Dokumentālās filmu sērijas veidotāji stājās pretī ekstremāliem laikapstākļiem, izsalkušiem plēsējiem, vētrainām jūrām, stāviem kalniem un saules svelmei, lai atklātu mežonīgās un nepieradināmās Patagonijas dabas dārgumus.

programme.title: Patagonija. Dzīve pasaules malā
programme.desc: Patagonija – viena no unikālākajām vietām uz Zemes, kur augsne ir neauglīga, bet jūra ir dzīvības bagāta. Izmantojot zemūdens kameras, helikopterus, dronus un GoPro kameras, vesela gada garumā filmēšanas komanda iemūžinājusi unikālus kadrus ar retiem dzīvniekiem, kādus nereti nav iespējams sastapt nekur citur. Dokumentālās filmu sērijas veidotāji stājās pretī ekstremāliem laikapstākļiem, izsalkušiem plēsējiem, vētrainām jūrām, stāviem kalniem un saules svelmei, lai atklātu mežonīgās un nepieradināmās Patagonijas dabas dārgumus.

programme.title: Mītu grāvēji: lūk, tava problēma!
programme.desc: Trieciendrošās brilles uz acīm, ugunsdzēšamais aparāts gatavībā – laiks eksperimentiem mītu grāvēju stilā! Pieredzes bagātie specefektu meistari Ādams Sevidžs un Džeimijs Hainemans desmit gadu garumā testējuši, vai Holivudas radītie mīti un urbānās leģendas iet roku rokā ar fizikas likumiem. Īpaši jaudīgākie, iespaidīgākie un pārsteidzošākie eksperimenti no Mītu grāvēju kolekcijas nu apkopoti unikālās un jautrās tematiskajās sērijās. Šajā triecienu, sprādzienu un blīkšķu enciklopēdijā atradīsies gan tādas tēmas kā ūdens, gāze, gravitācija, gan enerģija un spiediens.

programme.title: Mītu grāvēji: lūk, tava problēma!
programme.desc: Trieciendrošās brilles uz acīm, ugunsdzēšamais aparāts gatavībā – laiks eksperimentiem mītu grāvēju stilā! programme.title: A Cheetahs Pride
programme.sub-title: Chilli has kept all cubs alive for a month since the separation; Inara courts Shadow and may be expecting; a hunt injures Chilli and Inara returns just in time but is seen as an outsider at first.
programme.desc: Two cheetah mothers meet by chance; their cubs get mixed up and lead to one mother adopting the others cubs as her own. Stranger still is that they stay together instead of going their separate ways.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: An elephant is brought into AandE with a suspected deadly herpes virus, Kat treats the infected foot of a female elephant, and we visit the largest herd in the hospital swimming in the river.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: Ed and Dunc set out on a shark mission in Shark Bay to restock Ocean Park after having closed for Covid, and Rick weighs a Rottweiler using his local pubs forklift.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: Patagonia, in the extreme south of the South American continent, is one of the most varied and diverse territories on Earth; we visit penguins, elephant seals, sea lions and orcas.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peter faces a difficult calving at Ed McDonalds farm; can he get a baby out alive and save mum? Also, Julian faces one of his biggest ever challenges trying to treat one-ton Clydesdale horse Howard.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its 100 degrees and rising; as waterholes dry up, Julz is alarmed to find lions in the Kakuli packs favourite drinking spot but also gets to touch a wild dog for the first time ever.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: An elephant is brought into AandE with a suspected deadly herpes virus, Kat treats the infected foot of a female elephant, and we visit the largest herd in the hospital swimming in the river.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: Ed and Dunc set out on a shark mission in Shark Bay to restock Ocean Park after having closed for Covid, and Rick weighs a Rottweiler using his local pubs forklift.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: A compilation of the best moments of this series; it includes capuchin monkeys, pink dolphins swimming in the Amazon, the munguba tree, orcas, flamingos, the majestic jaguar and much more...
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt arrives in eastern Zambia to film three packs of wild dogs - the Manzis, Kakulis and Stork Colony - in three very different territories.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peters under extra pressure with Charlie the horse - he belongs to his niece Jess; when Julian sees Jackie Barlow, its usually about one of her alpacas, but today the patient is her little dog Isla.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian is called to an emergency on Tom Stockils farm and Peter removes an ominous looking lump for boxer dog Boot; this brings back bittersweet memories for Peter of his own beloved boxer Alf.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: An emotional emergency for Peter at a friends farm; Steves wife is seriously ill, and now her favourite sheeps life is in the balance. Julian tries to remove an abscess on Karine the alpacas chin.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Thailand
programme.sub-title: Southern Thailand is a place of spectacular natural beauty and wild parties, but its also a place where spirituality pervades every bit of life; its a natural wonderland for the animals here.
programme.desc: With towering limestone cliffs, hidden temples, the teeming city of Bangkok and imposing forests, Thailand is a sacred kingdom of awe-inspiring beauty.

programme.title: Wild Talk
programme.sub-title: We ask if animals can tell us what they are feeling; the existence of emotions in animals was first suggested by Darwin, but it is hard to prove when animals themselves cannot speak to us.
programme.desc: Recent years have seen an explosion of research into zoosemiotics (the science of animal communications); experts are listening to animals on their own terms to decode their secret languages.

programme.title: Hot Life: Africa
programme.sub-title: The caracal always lives where the land and vegetation are the same colour; it is stealthy and silent, a perfect master of camouflage and also a specialist in deserts and savannahs.
programme.desc: The threat of climate change is above all a risk for those who live in hot regions of the world like Africa; will its incredible living beings be able to resist a little longer?

programme.title: Polands Wild East
programme.desc: Eastern Poland is one of Europes last wild regions; the Biebrza lowlands make up the biggest national park in Poland and are of the utmost value for beavers, otters and countless aquatic birds.

programme.title: Wild Fighters
programme.sub-title: Territory is home, the place where animals rest, find food or have their children. Many animals are very territorial: they defend their clan against strangers as their survival depends on it.
programme.desc: Animals fight to ensure their survival, but what are the reasons that make them risk their lives every day, and what are the consequences of winning or losing these battles?

programme.title: A Game of Leopard Thrones
programme.sub-title: An old leopard queen is dead; when Thandi, the new queen, discovers the young cubs left behind, the fight for survival and for the crown of Djuma is on.
programme.desc: The queen of the leopard royal family of the Djuma Private Game Reserve in the Sabi Sands of South Africa has passed on - who will be crowned as the next leopard king and queen?

programme.title: Wild Boar: The Comeback
programme.desc: Hunted, slaughtered and exterminated - that was the wild boars fate throughout the last century. This is the story of the most underrated animal in Europes forests and its remarkable comeback.

programme.title: Fateful Planet
programme.sub-title: Around 540 million years ago, plate tectonics and climatic fluctuations kept throwing new life off track; evolution nevertheless progressed and even managed to make the leap onto land.
programme.desc: Our planet is marked by catastrophes whether collisions in the solar system, asteroid strikes, volcanic eruptions or global climatic crises; this series reconstructs some of these historic catastrophes.

programme.title: Fateful Planet
programme.sub-title: The dinosaurs dominated our planet for over 150 million years, but the dinosaurs vanished together with 75% of all species when the last mass extinction struck 66 million years ago.
programme.desc: Our planet is marked by catastrophes whether collisions in the solar system, asteroid strikes, volcanic eruptions or global climatic crises; this series reconstructs some of these historic catastrophes.

programme.title: Adapt to Survive
programme.sub-title: The great wildebeest migrations see millions of beasts moving in unison; meanwhile, seasonal events off the coasts open a passage for recently spawned sardines.
programme.desc: In this series, we delve into the mysterious world of animals and their methods to survive; take a journey into some of the wild worlds secret survival strategies that allows life to perpetuate.

programme.title: Brotherhood of Lions
programme.sub-title: Oloborr emerges as the leader of a pride which mainly relies on buffalo for food; as it faces obstacles in establishing dominance, tensions arise within the group.
programme.desc: This series tells the compelling and immersive story of the daily life of young lions and their challenges while growing up; it also showcases the struggles and triumphs of the lions.

programme.title: Gladiators
programme.sub-title: A dense and vibrant jungle dominates across the tropical Americas; here a group of young gladiators - including poison dart frogs, jaguars and coatis - are looking to earn their stripes.
programme.desc: There are animals born to fight and destined to face their foe across the planet; armed with weaponry, guile and tactics, these gladiators are prepared for battle. Only champions will reign supreme...

programme.title: Wild Battleground
programme.sub-title: Hot weather can sometimes be a killer; in the Sonoran Desert, temperatures peak at 80 degrees Celsius and its so hot that creatures choose to live and hunt in the night.
programme.desc: We show how animals use their unique attributes to defeat their opponents; they have honed their skills for millennia and have become masters of communication, camouflage, diplomacy and combat.

programme.title: Wild Texas
programme.desc: Told through the eyes of animals ranging from the mysterious blind catfish to the elusive ocelot, this documentary shares Texass most spectacular landscapes and natural events.

programme.title: Yellowstone: Americas Ticking Bomb
programme.desc: Yellowstone is one of the most powerful supervolcanoes on Earth; what would the consequences if it erupted? Leading experts show us the different possible scenarios of a Yellowstone super eruption.

programme.title: Grasslands: North Americas Hidden Wilderness
programme.desc: This is an exploration of a little-known landscape in the heartland of North America where wildlife co-exists peacefully with humans working on the front lines of unique conservation practices.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: A young bull elephant is rescued after breaking his leg in a violent thunderstorm, and laser technology is used to save an elephant who has come into AandE with severe burns.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: Dr Katy has been given custody of two endangered Hawksbill turtles in Karratha - we follow their journey back to the sea; Ed and Dunc collect squid for their sustainable eating display in Ocean Park.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: The desert of Chile is the driest in the world, but its marine currents are thought to be the richest on the planet; we come across Andean flamingos, burrowing owls, and the Fabians lizard.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Theres a shock in the borderlands where the Stork Colony pack roams, Vultures, elephants, baboons, and hyenas make for noisy neighbours for the Manzi pack, and the Kakuli pack goes missing.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Julz discovers lions in Manzi territory and is relieved when he finds the dogs safe, a brave puku antelope foils a Kakuli pack hunt, and the Stork pack recovers after losing a pup.

programme.title: Wild Fighters
programme.sub-title: Many animals form groups where there is an all-powerful leader; the position of leader is coveted by many, since it usually enjoys advantages when it comes to eating, resting, or reproducing.
programme.desc: Animals fight to ensure their survival, but what are the reasons that make them risk their lives every day, and what are the consequences of winning or losing these battles?

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Jeremy returns to Australias deadly Fitzroy River on his toughest quest yet - to catch the Glyphis shark, one of the worlds rarest fish. It is so elusive that it was only discovered very recently.
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Brown Hyenas
programme.desc: Follow along on a journey as we explore the mysteries of the Makgadikgadi pans through the eyes of a brown hyena mother and her clan as they navigate merciless temperatures.

programme.title: Wild Fighters
programme.sub-title: The language of love and the fight for reproduction stimulate the most striking and diverse behaviours of the animal world: dances, challenges, fights, pulses, and battles to mate with females.

programme.title: Europes Wilderness
programme.sub-title: The musk ox roamed together with mammoths thousands of years ago; now the only remaining herds live in Scandinavia at the Dovrefjell National Park in Norway and in the Harjedaalen area in Sweden.
programme.desc: We present six of the largest, rarest and fastest animals in Europe; how does climate change affect them, and how do they defend their habitat against human influence?

programme.title: Europes Wilderness
programme.sub-title: This episode introduces a rare inhabitant of the Mediterranean mountains: the mouflon sheep that originate from Corsica, Sardinia and Cyprus.
programme.desc: We present six of the largest, rarest and fastest animals in Europe; how does climate change affect them, and how do they defend their habitat against human influence?

programme.title: Scotland: A Wild Year
programme.sub-title: Its autumn in Scotland and the clock is ticking; as daylight diminishes and the weather cools, food resources dwindle. We witness how Atlantic salmon, red deer, and red squirrels prepare for winter.
programme.desc: We visit Scotlands secret wild places and the unexpected animals that live there; filmed over four dramatic seasons, these are the extraordinary stories of Scotlands spectacular iconic wildlife.

programme.title: Scotland: A Wild Year
programme.sub-title: This winter is breaking all the rules as its unusually warm; the warmth has brought red deer out of hiding and is a disaster for mountain hares whose only defence from enemies is to hide in the snow.
programme.desc: We visit Scotlands secret wild places and the unexpected animals that live there; filmed over four dramatic seasons, these are the extraordinary stories of Scotlands spectacular iconic wildlife.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: The team of vets are attempting to rehabilitate a mentally ill young bull in the hospitals male herd, Kat gets her hands dirty with elephant poo, and Paul helps the vets treat an infected abscess.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: Katy treats a Staffie with a deadly disease, a Great Dane rescues a dog needing a blood transfusion, and Rick and zoologist Ed Swinhoe test a wild dingos DNA in the outback near Exmouth.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: The interior of Brazil is a very varied territory where ecosystems as different as dry forest and flood plains mix; here we find the strange maned wolf, the shy giant anteater, and capuchin monkeys.
